message.content:
There are several differences between industrial and artisanal chocolate as well as the process of making them. Some key areas to focus on include:

1. Production scale: Industrial chocolate is produced in large-scale factories, whereas artisanal chocolate is made by smaller operations, often with more hands-on techniques and attention to detail.

2. Ingredients quality: Artisanal chocolatiers generally use high-quality cocoa beans sourced from specific regions known for their exceptional flavors. In contrast, industrial chocolate typically uses lower quality beans that may incorporate a blend of sources and can be less flavorful or even bitter.

3. Cacao percentage: Industrial chocolates usually have a lower cacao percentage compared to artisanal chocolates because they prioritize cost efficiency over flavor intensity. As a result, mass-produced chocolates tend to rely on sugar or other additives for taste enhancement which compromises the original essence of cocoa.

4. Processing methods: Many artisans roast their own cocoa beans in small batches to achieve desired flavors during bean-to-bar production processes while factory-made versions involve roasting at high volumes without much control over individual batches.

5. Conching time: Artisans spend longer durations refining their chocolates through conching (grinding) than factories do which results in smoother consistency and enhanced flavors due to friction-induced heat release of volatile compounds associated with pleasant aroma characteristics.

6. Additives & preservatives: Commercially available industrial chocolates often contain additives such as soy lecithin (emulsifier), hydrogenated oils, artificial colors or flavors aiming at cost reduction or prolonged shelf life advantages; consequently sacrificing overall product purity aspects unlike handcrafted counterparts who prefer minimal intervention emphases respecting both ingredient origin transparency along holistic manufacturing values considerations priorities wise sustainable long-term visions encompassing profitability concerns secondary outcomes benefits realizations perspectives bases enduring successes
